title: Are Turks mixed with Greeks? - Quora

response.answer_text: I guess, yes. Well, since I am a Turkish guy, I wondered our genetic resemblance with surrounding countries and made a research, the result I saw was something I expected. Our genetic resemblance with Creteans are %80, whereas a bit lower with Greece and interestingly South Italy. But Turkish genetic resemblance with Armenians, Persians and Syrians are high as well. Though the highest is Cretans, Greeks and Armenians. The resemblance with Italians are above %60 so this shows that Turks got Greek a bit. Since we knew from the history, MesoSouth Italia was inhabitated by Ancient Greeks once, that's the only explanation we could find in TurkoItalian similarity. And Eastern Anatolians share the gene of its neighbours. Armenians was already largely existent until 1920 in Eastern Anatolia and Kurdish are the mix of PersoArmenian race so maybe this high percentage is stemming from them.

Greeks mixed with Turks and Turks mixed with Greeks. Both were huge empires that controlled vast pieces of land across continents for several centuries. So mixing was inevitable. Mixing is very common throughout history. Neanderthals mixed with Homo Sapiens. Germanic people with Romans, Celts with Vikings… it goes on and on forever. What is U.S.A. population if not a huge mix? In anthropological terms, the so called “Greek Miracle” is explained by exactly that kind of mixing of cultures and people. It happens since forever and will continue to happen in eternity, if our species is meant to survive.

The difference between Turks and Greeks is cultural, not genetic. The people who now identify themselves as Greek or Turkish were, about 950 years ago, all either “Greek” or Armenian. The reason I say “Greek” rather than Greek is that until very recently the people we call Greek were actually Roman (and are still to an extent called that in Turkey). Two thousand years before that that the peopleof those regions were Achaean, Doric, Phrygian, Bithynian, Hittite, Hurrian, Mittani and more besides. But very modern Greek and turn are descended from those people.
